result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan R. Davidson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

--to comply with DNA sample to the DOC or designee upon demand

records.addlTxt:
Cases #14CF78 and #14CF88 called at 1:34[MO]
Defendant Bryan R. Davidson in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Witt indicates that Counsel has reached an agreement and will proceed to Plea and Sentencing today.  

On Motion of that State, the Court strikes both the location 'near certain places' enhancer and the Court strikes the reapeater enhancer on Case #14CF88

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 and Count #2 in Case #14CF78 and plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1 in Case #14CF88; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
The Court finds that Mr. Davidson is a Repeater as to Case #14CF78.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3, #4, and #5 in Case #14CF78.

Atty. Witt requests that Mr. Davidson be allowed to remain employed for his father's tax prepartation company.
The State has no objection.

On Count #1 and #2 in Case # 14CF78 and Count #1 in Case #14CF88, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--No Contact with Nickolas Weihert OR Thomas Schoechert
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes including  attendance at AA and NA meetings or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise deemed appropriate per agent. 
-- Maintain absolute sobriety
-- to have no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, and to take prescribed drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--be subject to random drug and alcohol screens
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--the Court officially authorizes Mr. Davidson to remain employed at A-TAX Services in Watertown and Milwaukee
--In Count #1, in Case #14CF78 to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--In Count #2, in Case # 14CF78 to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--in Count #1, in Case #14CF88 to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 drug testing charge
--In case #14CF78:to pay restitution of $370 to Thomas Schoechert, $170 of this amount is joint and several with the Co-actor Nickolas Weihert
--In case #14CF78:to pay 10% restitution processing surcharge
--to comply with DNA sample to the DOC or designee upon demand



Days credit for time already served:  0 days
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given.
Recess:2:16pm
Status conference on February 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 21, 2015 at 03:40 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Preliminary hearing on December 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling notice

[Clerk: MK]
Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
cases #14CF78 and #14CF88 called at 11:06am. 
Defendant Bryan R. Davidson in court with Attorney Michael C Witt.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Witt provides a summary of Mr. Davidson's ongoing treatment plan including that the intent is that Mr. Davidson is planning to travel soon to Arizona to a "Sober Living Facility" that involves intensive outpatient treatment and training. This residential program is a six month program, so the Defense is requesting that length of adjournment.
Both parties confirm their previous waiver of Preliminary Hearing time limits. 

The Court adds conditions of bond: 
--Mr. Davidson is to fully cooperate and participate in the Sober Living Facility program discussed in court
--Mr. Davidson is to maintain regular and ongoing contact with Attorney Witt.
recess 11:11am.

NEXT:  (1) Attorney Witt is to arrange for the Arizona facility program to provide updates every sixty days that verify to the Court that Mr. Davidson is positively engaged with the program (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing on both cases on December 12th at 8:30am.
Status conference on June 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.
For continuance
